user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of condition:
```c
static int condition(void)
{
	int ret;
	int ts_created;
	pthread_t tids[THREADS];

	/** TC1 consumer threads go first */
	/** create 10 consumer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 producer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** wait for consumer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);

	/** TC2 producer threads go first */
	/** create 10 producer threads first */
	ret = metal_run_noblock(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL, tids,
				&ts_created);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create consumer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

	/** create 10 consumer threads next */
	ret = metal_run(THREADS, consumer_thread, NULL);
	if (ret < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to create producer thread: %d.\n",
			  ret);
		goto out;
	}

out:
	/** wait for producer threads to finish */
	metal_finish_threads(THREADS, (void *)tids);
	return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
ret = metal_run(THREADS, producer_thread, NULL);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call site itself does not modify any function parameter, so it does not violate Rule 17.8. A concrete violation would occur inside the definition of metal_run if it assigns to its parameter variables (for example: metal_run(int n, void (*f)(void), void *arg) { n = 0; /* or */ arg = some_ptr; }) — assigning to the pointer parameter itself (arg = …) or to a non‑pointer parameter would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. Note that modifying the object pointed to (e.g. *((type *)arg) = …) is permitted, but dereferencing NULL would be undefined behaviour.
